revised_title: Description and Analysis of Three New Toxoplasma Species
tldr: The author describes three new species of Toxoplasma found in various animals, discussing their morphology, distribution, and life cycle. These parasites are found in the blood and large mononuclear leucocytes, causing wasting and blood destruction in affected animals. The author also notes the uncertainty surrounding the systematic position of the genus Toxoplasma and the need for further research on their complete life history.
